education_text.0: Paul Dourish (born 1966) is a      Computer scientist computer scientist best known for his work and research at the intersection of      Computer science computer science and      Social science social scienceDourish has published three books and over 100 scientific articles, and holds 19 US patentsBorn and raised in      Glasgow,      Scotland, Dourish studied at   In 2000, Dourish moved to Southern California, when he joined the faculty at the      University of California, Irvine University of California, IrvineHis research tends to draw both on technical and social domains, and speak to the relationship between themAt      redirect    UC Irvine UC Irvine, he is a professor of Informatics in the Donald Bren School of Information and      Computer science Computer Sciences department, where he is a member of the Laboratory for Ubiquitous Computing and Interaction (LUCI), and in the interdisciplinary graduate program in   At      redirect    UC Irvine UC Irvine, he is a professor of Informatics in the Donald Bren School of Information and      Computer science Computer Sciences department, where he is a member of the Laboratory for Ubiquitous Computing and Interaction (LUCI), and in the interdisciplinary graduate program in   Along with being a member of the aforementioned organizations, Dourish is a  conspirator  in the Laboratory for Ubiquitous Computing and Interaction, a faculty associate of the Center for Research on Information Technology and Organizations, and a coordinator of the People and Practices PAPRDourish mainly performs research in three specific areas of computer interaction (HCI)Previous projects that Dourish has worked on include studies of privacy and spatialityDourish has published three booksHis second book,  Divining a Digital FutureHis third book,  The Stuff of BitsIn addition to the three books, he has published conference proceedings, journal papers, conference papers, book chapters, technical reports, essay Paul Dourish is a professor of informatics, computer science, and anthropology at UC Irvine
